desc:
Surprise

Equivalent to the ft_transcendence project in the new 42cursus.

name: Web Basics 02 - Pinterest
desc: test

name: APCSP - Internet Simulator
desc: As a class, we will work through Code.org's Internet Simulator exercises. They are a fun way to relive the challenges that early internet developers had to solve in order to create the web as we know it today.

name: SonicPi
desc: Sonic Pi is a nice library that you can you to synthesize audio tracks. Use this project as an introduction to computer music synthesis - either a remix or an original composition. Want to go further with music-related coding? If so then head on over to Map Your Own.

name: Cretan Bull
desc: Defeat the Champion

name: Introduction to Wordpress
desc: The purpose of this rush is to recreate a view of airbnb.fr with Wordpress. From there you will have to integrate some specific pages. Once this rush is validated, the basic features of Wordpress will not have secrets anymore for you!

name: Retro-MFA
desc: The goal of Retro MFA is to find pictures hidden in a closed file format.

name: Day 07
desc: Today you will develop your own frameworks that use the reflection mechanism

name: Day 07
desc: This day will help you with data visualization in Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly.

name: [DEPRECATED] CPP Module 00 (OwO)
desc: This first module of C++ is designed to help you understand the specifities of the language when compared to C. Time to dive into Object Oriented Programming!

name: Arkanoid
desc: Arkanoid is an arcade game of the brick-breaker type developed by Taito in 1986 and carried on many family supports. The game is based on the same principle as Breakout by Atari Inc. (1976). The purpose of this rush is to recode the game Arkanoid in C with the support of an OpenGL Framework, so it's all about happiness!

name: ft_shmup
desc: The goal of this rush is to implement a simplistic shoot-em-up-style game in your terminal.

name: Day 08
desc: Today you will learn about enterprise-level Java development and the basics of the Spring framework

name: Day 08
desc: This day will help you with basic tasks of machine learning in Python.

name: wong_kar_wai
desc: The purpose of this rush is to recode the 2048 game in C for a console display. It's not very complicated, and yet, many of you will fail because of a breach of trust and lack of checks... And to be honest, 2048 is more complex than you might think. Good luck anyway!

name: Day 09
desc: Today you will implement the basic mechanism of a client/server application based on Java—Sockets API

name: Carnifex (LISP)
desc: In this rush, you have the chance to (re)discover two amazing elements of computer science

name: Rush 00
desc: Today you will implement quite a complicated game business process using Maven build tool

name: Rush 00
desc: This rush will help you to strengthen the skills acquired in the previous days

name: CPP Module 03 (OwO)
desc: This module is about inheritance in C++

name: Cluedo (Prolog)
desc: This rush aims to introduce you to logical programming with Prolog. This rush is progressive. First, you need to work on a small exercise to understand the syntax of the language. Then you have a rather classic puzzle to solve. And finally comes the really playful part: the resolution of a rather dense puzzle!

name: Rush 01
desc: This rush will help you to strengthen the skills acquired in the previous days

name: Rush 01
desc: Today you will implement an actual client/server game with a full-scale interface

name: CPP Module 04 (OwO)
desc: Subtype polymorphism, abstract classes, interfaces

name: YASL
desc: YASL is a rather old language, which works with several inverted stacks. The details of this concept are presented in the man provided with the YASL interpreter. You will therefore have to rethink the way you store and represent program data.

name: Rage Against The aPi
desc:
Using the RATP’s API, you will have to create your own travel planning application.
By entering a starting point and an ending point, your application will have to determinethe most efficient route using RATP metro lines to get from start to finish.

name: AlCu
desc:
Alum1 is a game based on matches.
This rush will make you work on efficient progamming methods and algorithms

name: Mexican Standoff
desc:
The purpose of this rush is to show you the (infinite?) features of the two mammoths of text editing: emacs and vim.
Today, you will move beyond the old quarrels and use both! The opportunity to get rid of your stereotypes (trade them for certitudes, that's better), on the one hand, and on the other hand, never again to have to ask how you get out of this ****** editor opened by mistake, for god's sake.

name: Matrice Air Data
desc:
MATRICE en partenariat avec 8 acteurs privés et publics de la région PACA - la métropole d’Aix Marseille, le Groupe La Poste, The camp, AtmoSud, le groupe Tera... - lance le programme ​matrice Air data pour répondre au projet Urban Innovative Actions de la Commission européenne.
Tu veux devenir acteur de changement?
Tu es passionné d’environnement?
Tu veux améliorer la qualité de l’air que l’on respire?
Tu veux encourager l’engagement citoyen?
Les défis techniques ne te font pas peur ?
Cette Matrice est faite pour toi !

name: Exam00
desc: A hora da verdade

name: Matrice Solutions Urbaines
desc:
Objectif: comment rendre le logement social plus en phase avec la société numérique d’aujourd’hui ? 

Quelques thématiques pour t’inspirer : 
Comment rendre le logement social foisonnant et accueillant ? 
Et si en plus d’être un logement, le logement social était en vérité un véritable écosystème d’activités pour ses habitants ? 
Comment on pourrait occuper les espaces communs ? Les couloirs, les toits, les ascenseurs… (inspiration : ascenseur de 42)...
Comment on pourrait organiser et valoriser des dynamiques de solidarités et de communautés ? 

Partenaire: l’IRP, acteur des logements sociaux, est partant pour mettre des bâtiments à Meudon et Mantes la Jolie à notre disposition, pour y repenser nouveaux concepts et aménagements
Plus d’infos: https://matrice.io/uploads/solutions-urbaines.pdf

name: Bomberman
desc: Bomberman is a classic video game: as simple in gameplay as it is fun to play! You will profit from its simplicity for your first big C++ project of professional quality. You will re-code a version of Bomberman in C++ and with OpenGL, the goal being to make the most complete game

name: Minitalk
desc: The purpose of this rush is to make you create a small data exchange program using UNIX signals.

name: Pipex
desc: This rush is about discovering through programming, and going into detail, a UNIX mechanism that you already know. This mechanism, if the title of the subject does not mean anything to you, is the Pipe (AKA '|')! Enjoy!

name: libunit
desc:
As part of this rush, you will design a testing micro-framework in C, to torture in every
way your functions in your C projects, with some subtleties as well. This Micro-framework
will be created as a static C library that you will include in your future test functions.

name: ft_linear_regression
desc:
This project will be your first steps into AI and Machine Learning. You're going to start with a simple, basic machine learning algorithm. 
You will have to create a program that predicts the price of a car by using a linear function train with a gradient descent algorithm.

name: Frozen
desc:
In this rush, you have the chance to (re)discover the amazing world of IRC. Even better,
you have to opportunity to do it in a new language, Go.

name: ft_minirogue
desc: Tentez votre percée dans la scène indépendante du jeu vidéo en codant un Rogue Like de votre cru.

name: KrpSim
desc: This algorithm project consists of creating a program that will optimize rendering of a process graph, with some resource constraints. It’s up to you to explore the existing algorithms and choose, possibly create, what you seem most fit. For this project, you can choose the language you want

name: Numpy
desc: You like high-level mathematics and snakes? This Rush is designed for YOU!

name: 21sh
desc: We move on to serious things! With 21sh, you will have to write an implementation close to the reality of the read, eval, print loop of a shell. Using the Termcaps library, you will add a functional and useful line edition to the read part of your shell. Cursor, Edit, History, Multiline, etc. But especially for the eval part, forget the function ft_split that you used in your Minishell to cut the line of command entered by the user! 21sh will be your first realistic interpreter, and as such, this project will allow you to discover the lexical, syntactic, and semantic analyzes common to interpreters and compilers. With appropriate data structures and processing, adding pipe (|) and redirection (<, <<, >>.>) Management will be very easy!

name: ft_tar
desc: To understand how file archives are created and manipulated.

name: Rubik
desc: Non-trivial algorithm project: create a Rubik’s cube solver. You can choose the language you want for this project.

name: HumanGL
desc: This intermediate openGL project is an introduction to hierarchy modeling. You will learn to use matrices in order to link various parts of a humanoid model, and animate them.

name: Wordle
desc: In this exercise, you will study the popular word game Wordle and write a series of programs related to it.

name: Swifty Companion
desc: Ce projet a pour but de vous initier au développement d'application iOS. Il s'agit de réaliser, en Swift, une application qui permet de récupérer les informations des élèves de 42, en utilisant l’API de l'intranet de 42.

name: Abstract Games
desc: In this rush, you will implement a popular abstract strategy game.

name: Camagru
desc: After the PHP piscine, this project will put you back in the water: you will create, in PHP, a small Instagram-like site that enables users to make and share photo edits. You will thus implement, with bare hands (frameworks are forbidden), basic functionalities you find on most sites with a user database.

name: Music Collection
desc: In this rush, you will use the API of a popular music streaming service to print out a catalog of your music collection.

name: Sound Synthesis
desc: In this rush, you will create a synthesizer able to play a simple music description file format.

name: ft_ping
desc: Re-coding the ping command will let you get acquainted with TCP/IP communication between two machines on a network

name: Game of Life
desc: In this rush, you will implement Conway's Game of Life, and attempt to make your implementation as fast as possible.

name: Fillit
desc: Fillit is a project which involves discovering and getting acquainted with a recurrent problem in programming: the search of an optimal solution among a very large number of possibilities in a reasonable amount of time. In this project, you will arrange Tetriminos among them and determine the smallest square that can fit all of them.

name: ft_traceroute
desc: Re-coding the traceroute command will be the opportunity to deepen your knowledge of TCP/IP networks by following the paths of an IP packet from one machine to another.

name: ft_nmap
desc: Re-coding the nmap command will be the opportunity to deepen your knowledge of TCP/IP networks and thus understand advanced use of threads in real life.

name: Libft-old
desc: Ce premier projet en tant qu'étudiant de 42 va vous faire consolider vos acquis de piscine. Vous allez recoder un certain nombre de fonctions de la librairie C standard, ainsi que d'autres fonctions utilitaires que vous réutiliserez tout au long de votre cursus.

name: Fillit
desc: Fillit est un projet vous permettant de decouvrir et/ou de vous familiariser avec une problematique recurrente en programmation : la recherche d'un solution optimale parmis un tres grand nombre de possibilites, dans un delais raisonable. Dans le cas de ce projet, il s'agira d'agencer des Tetriminos entre eux et de determiner le plus petit carre possible pouvant les accuellir.

name: Matcha
desc: This second project introduces you to a more advanced tool to realize your web applications: the micro-framework. We invite you to create, in the language of your choice, a dating site. Interactions between users will be at the heart of the project!

name: Hypertube
desc: Dernier projet de sa série, le projet Hypertube vous invite à découvrir une catégorie d'outil extrêmement puissante : les frameworks MVC. Vous apprendrez à manipuler un MVC, dans le langage de votre choix, pour réaliser un site de streaming de video téléchargées via le protocole BitTorrent.

name: ft_turing
desc: ft_turing will help you discover the turing model using imperative programming through an implementation of this model with OCaml

name: Snow Crash
desc: This project is an introduction to computer security. Snow Crash will make you discover security in various sub-domains, with a developer-oriented approach. You will become familiar with several languages (ASM/Perl/PHP…), develop a certain logic to understand unknown programs, and become aware of problems linked to simple programming errors

name: Darkly
desc: Projet introductif à la sécurité en informatique dans le domaine spécifique du web, ce projet va vous faire disséquer un site web vulnérable. Ce faisant, vous allez développer votre propre façon de penser sécurité dans une application web et prendre conscience des problèmes liés à de simples erreurs de développement, autant d'un point de vue programmation que d'un point de vue conception.

name: C Exam Training
desc:
Les examens machine permettent de vérifier vos acquis lorsque vous êtes seuls face à votre travail, sans vos peers et sans internet.
Pour valider ce projet (qui est un pré-requis à votre départ en 1er stage), il vous faut valider 5 examens avec une note minimum de 75.

name: Swifty Proteins
desc: Ce projet a pour but de vous initier a Scene Kit un framework Apple pour créer scenes en 3D. Vous devrez principalement réaliser une application qui modélisera des ligands en 3D, cette application sera aussi l'occasion d'approfondir vos connaissances en Swift et des framework Apple tels que Touch ID, le partage sous iOS, les gestures ainsi que les UISearchBar.

name: ft_ality
desc: This project will get you acquainted with problems linked to automatic syntax analysis (“parsin”) by studying finite automation in a combat game.

name: Libft-old
desc: Ce premier projet en tant qu'étudiant de 42 va vous faire consolider vos acquis de piscine. Vous allez recoder un certain nombre de fonctions de la librairie C standard, ainsi que d'autres fonctions utilitaires que vous réutiliserez tout au long de votre cursus.

name: XV
desc: This project was designed by the Daher company and has you develop a graphic interface under Unity for optimizing industrial processes.

name: Particle System
desc: This infographics project is an introduction to the wonderful world of GPU. Through OpenGL and OpenCL usage, allowing to parrellelize calculations, you must create a particle system while respecting the performance constraints

name: Friends with Benefits
desc: Friends with Benefits est un projet en partenariat avec l'entreprise Cozy-Cloud. Il vous permettra d'utiliser leur outil pour créer une One Page Application, en open source, qui sera ensuite disponible sur leur marketplace.

name: init
desc: Ce projet est une introduction à l'administration système et au réseau, proposé par l'équipe slash16.

name: roger-skyline-2
desc: Ce projet proposé par slash16 vous donne la possibilité de monter votre propre infrastructure inspiré de celle de 42.

name: cloud-1
desc: Ce projet est une introduction aux serveurs en cloud.

name: ft_linux
desc: The first project of the Kernel branch! This is a simple LFS so that you can build your own distribution which will be used in the next projects.

name: little-penguin-1
desc: The start of a series of challenges inspired by Eudyptula. You will get acquainted with many points of Kernel development.

name: RainFall
desc: Rainfall is an iso challenge slightly more complex than Snow Crash. You will have to dive deep into reverse engineering, learn to reconstruct a code, and understand it to detect faults. Will you reach the last level?

name: Dr Quine
desc: This small algo project will get you acquainted with auto-replication problems and confront the Kleene recursion theorem.

name: Woody Woodpacker
desc: A logical follow-up project on nm/otools that is designed to modify the headers of a ELF64 file. The goal here is to add a chunk of code and hide a non-stripped part of a file.

name: Matt Daemon
desc: A Unix project to create a daemon of type server. This server will listen on a given port and interpret a list of commands.

name: Process and Memory
desc: An introduction to syscalls and memory management within linux kernel.

name: Drivers and Interrupts
desc: Learn how to connect a driver to your kernel. We will use a keyboard driver for this project.

name: Filesystem
desc: Create your own filesystem, for your linux kernel.

name: KFS-2
desc: Discover the world of Kernel Programming and learn how to create your very own Kernel from scratch.

name: KFS-1
desc: Discover the world of "Kernel Programming" and learn how to create your very own Kernel from scratch.

name: KFS-3
desc: Third Kernel from Scratch project. Learn how to manage the memory in you kernel.

name: Music Room
desc: Projet en partenariat avec Deezer. Créez en groupe une application mobile complète de playlist collaborative en utilisant les SDK et API de Deezer. Au programme : du développement natif mobile, du développement de back-end et de la création d'API REST.

name: Piscine Python Django
desc: Prenez en main la conception d'un backend WEB brillant par sa qualité et sa performance avec le framework Django.

name: Piscine Ruby on Rails
desc: Apprenez à concevoir une WebApp puissante et robuste avec le Framework Rails.

name: Red Tetris
desc: L’objectif de ce projet est de développer un jeu de tetris multijoueurs en réseau à partir d’une pile logicielle exclusivement Full Stack Javascript

name: H42N42
desc: Project introducing Framework OCSIGEN, used to create applications rich in OCaml. Design a simulator of bugs escaping a dangerous virus.

name: Famine
desc: Welcome to the wonderful world of viruses, trojans and other <Insert random antiVirus software>… Your goal here is to put your skills on handling binary files and make your first virus. WARNING: this project is solely for educational purposes!

name: KFS-4
desc: Project aimed at creating an Interrupt Description Table and handle interrupts within your Kernel

name: KFS-5
desc: You must now develop process managing in your Kernel, by implementing how to interpret the command :(){ :|:& }

name: Matrice
desc: Le programme entrepreneurial Matrice vous propose régulièrement de vous engager autour d'un thème sur une création d'entreprise. D'une durée pouvant aller de 10 à 16 mois, ce programme peut éventuellement être l'ultime étape de votre cursus et vous mener jusqu'au certificat délivré par l'école.

name: Hercules
desc: During 12 weeks, try to walk among the half-gods by doing the infamous twelve labors of Hercules

name: ComputorV2
desc: Maintenant que vous avez programmé votre résolveur d'équations, il est temps d'aller un peu plus loin. Computor V2 vous propose de créer votre propre calculette en ligne de commande, qui va intégrer votre computorv1 ainsi que des fonctions de calculs matriciels, de resolution de fonctions, de calculs sur nombre imaginaires etc...

name: docker-1
desc: Premier projet sur l'écosystème Docker. Apprenez à réfléchir en containers à travers ce sujet, qui vous fera manipuler le binaire docker et créer vos premiers containers avec des Dockerfiles

name: Piscine Interview
desc: Learn how to learn again with Big(O) notation and other cool things

name: avaj-launcher
desc: First projet of the Java projects arc. Implementation of a simple Java program according to a given class diagram written in UML.

name: swingy
desc: This is the second project from the Java world at 42. You will learn to develop GUI applications with the SWING framework, in order to create an RPG game.

name: fix-me
desc: Final project of the Java Programming arc. Write a program that simulates stock exchanges and deals with trading algorithms, with networking and socket implementations.

name: KFS-6
desc: Keep on developping your own kernel. This project will help you set up your own filesystem.

name: KFS-7
desc: This project will teach you how to build your own syscalls for your kernel, as well as user accounts, sockets, and a Unix-like hierarchy. Almost a full kernel here!

name: KFS-8
desc: Build a module interface for your kernel.

name: KFS-9
desc: Create an ELF parser and loader for your kernel.

name: KFS-X
desc: This is the final kernel project. It just requires you to create a complete linux environment. Maybe name your kernel aswell?

name: Piscine After Effects Day 00
desc: Les propriétés de base

name: Piscine After Effects Day 01
desc: Masques et lissage de vitesse

name: Piscine After Effects Day 02
desc: Calques 3D, caméras et lumières

name: Piscine After Effects Day 03
desc: Keying, tracking et rotoscoping

name: Piscine After Effects Day 04
desc: Expressions & Photoshop link

name: Piscine After Effects Rush 00
desc: Liberté créative

name: Pestilence
desc: Second virus project. Reuse the Famine base to add a hiding method of your code.

name: War
desc: Third virus project. Reuse Pestilence, and manage to have your binary modify its signature on runtime.

name: Death
desc: Last virus project. Create with your Famine, Pestilence and War a real metamorphic code.

name: Boot2Root
desc: Security Challenge. In a group, search for various means to pass root on the ISO given to you.

name: Durex
desc: Utilisez vos skills sur la création de daemon pour créer votre premier trojan basique.

name: Override
desc: If you thought Rainfall was easy, here’s a more daunting challenge. Override is the last ISO that will have you search for faults present in the protected binaries, and re-build these binaries depending on their behavior.

name: KIFT
desc:
Knight Industries needs C programmers to prototype and implement a new
VUI for the famous K.I.T.T. "Knight Industries Two Thousand".

name: D00
desc: First day of the Summer Bootcamp

name: D01
desc: First day of the Summer Bootcamp

name: D02
desc:
Enumerables (arrays and hashes)
Iteration, blocks and loops
taking parameters into the program

name: D03
desc:
Modules (methods)
Why methods? Don’t Repeat Yourself

name: D04 Advanced
desc: Simulate buying a selling Bitcoin through an API!

name: D05
desc: Create a personal HTML/CSS page (from PHP piscine)

name: D06
desc: Code Connect 4

name: D07
desc: Code Hangman

name: D08
desc: Take one of the command line games and put it in a web browser with Sinatra.

name: D04 Basics
desc: Choose this one if you want to review what we've covered thus far.

name: harassment_policy
desc:
École 42 USA is committed to providing an environment free of harassment, bullying and hazing.

To agree to this policy:
please download the attached file called agree. Rename it as agree.txt and add it in a directory called policy on your repository after entering login to replace the underscores.

name: Reverse Game of Life
desc: Reverse the time in the Conway's Game of Life! Write your own machine learning algorithm to predict boards in the start of the game.

name: greenlight
desc:
We’re going green!
This project is part of the 42 Maker movement,
students are encouraged to come up with ideas that are:
Super futuristic and Awesome.
But also must be full of learning and technology!
Your project is to create what was first known as ft_saladtowers: A hydroponic vertical planter, growing with the light of LEDs. Then program sensors to tell the health of the plant.
With the aim to grow your skills, grow plants and have fun!

name: Check Your Dorms
desc:
This is a Peer-2-peer review to see if an individual is still invested in 42. 

In order to stay in the Dorms, an individual must validate (1) 35 hours of log time per week (2) 1 level per month and (3) 2 exams per month. If they are failing any of the requirements at any point in time, the individual is automatically registered to this project and has one month to restore whatever gap there may be.

name: Stairway_to_42
desc: Light up the way to the 2nd floor of the Lab.

name: First-Internship
desc: This first step in a company is an important step in your curriculum at WeThinkCode_. This internship is an opportunity for you to discover how things work in a company and polish your adaptation and technical skills. It's also a first experience for your resume and the possibility to discover your chosen fields.

name: ft_zenko
desc: Scality Zenko Hackathon Project

name: ft_vox
desc: ft_vox is a project to introduce the voxel engine, inspired by minecraft, in which you must create a randomly generated world.

name: Walking Marvin
desc:
Teach little Marvin to walk!
Marvin needs help to get back on his feet, and you're the only one who can help him! You will discover neural networks and OpenAI Gym, understand deep learning and develop your own learning strategy!

name: ft_ssl_rsa
desc: You will code your own random prime number generator and use it to make private RSA keys.

name: ft_ssl_des
desc: You will recode part of the OpenSSL program, specifically BASE64, DES-ECB and DES-CBC.

name: C Exam Alone In The Dark - Intermediate
desc: A new set of exam questions once you validate the C Beginner exam. You will have to verify what you have learned when you are alone without your peers and without the internet in a limited time. To validate this project, you must validate 5 exams with a minimum score of 84.

name: ft_debut
desc: 42 prerequisites, understanding 42 culture, core values and the meaning of life

name: Bistromatic
desc: Intro to Starfleet Academy

name: UNIT Factory Harassment & Tolerance Policy
desc:
UNIT Factory is committed to providing an environment free of harassment, bullying and hazing.

To agree to this policy:
please download the attached file called agree. Rename it as agree.txt and add it in a directory called policy on your repository after entering login to replace the underscores.

name: Startup-Internship
desc: This first step in a company is an important part of the 42 curriculum. This project is an alternative to an internship for those of you who have an entrepreneurial spirit, but do not commit yourself to it lightly: it is very demanding, and can in no way be an excuse to avoid finding an internship. Only concrete, solid and serious entrepreneurial projects will be accepted.

name: Grimly
desc: Shortest path algorithms project

name: H2S Project Authorship - T2
desc: This project is for HackHighSchool mentors to contribute to the high school curriculum by writing a project of their choice.

name: DSLR
desc: Sujet proposé par l'association 42AI.  Découvrez la Data Science à travers ce projet dans la reconstitution du Choixpeau Magique de Poudlard ! Attention, ceci n'est pas un sujet sur les appareils photos.

name: CCMN
desc: Create an application or a program that can use the wi-fi architecture and the Cisco connected mobile experiences solution. Explore network programmability and try to make real software product. Implement REST that exposes a specific service or software functionality while protecting the rest of the application. As a bonus, you will be able to create your own Spark bot “catch_me” and you can manage your app by using it

name: ShaderPixel
desc: Now that you are familiar with 3D objects and basic rendering techniques, we can get serious now and really work in the space of the graphic card. It’s up to you to design and create the weirdest objects thanks to shaders programming.

name: Hack Your Own Adventure
desc: Are you coming to 42 to work on your own idea of a project? Add your code and notes here so we can see what you find interesting, and look into adding something like it for other students to try.

name: H2S Project Authorship - T1
desc: You can get credit through this project by writing a project for the HackHighSchool students on a topic you are knowledgeable about. Please use the TimeLog file to track your time, this project should take you approximately 50hrs to complete. You will have 2 corrections -- one by the H2S admin, and one by a peer at 42, preferably someone who is knowledgeable about your chosen topic.

name: H2S Mentorship - Project Auditing
desc: This is the project portal to submit solutions and feedback for projects that you complete on the H2S branch.

name: GUImp
desc: The goal of this project is to create a graphic interface library. You will have to prove it works properly with a small 2D image editing software. This library must be as complete and modular as possible, the goal being to re-use it in your future projects.

name: HackerRank University CodeSprint 4
desc: Participate in a 3 day coding contest to sharpen your skills and represent 42! Sign up for the contest at the link under "Attachments". Set your school to "42" (not 42 Silicon Valley or 42Born2Code). We will upload points based on how many questions you answer and how far you get on the leaderboard!

name: userspace_digressions
desc: Make your own userspace init binary.

name: Netflix Hackathon
desc: Netflix would like to partner with 42 on a challenge. The contestants will receive a 2-hour presentation by the Studio Technologies team at Netflix on March 9th at 11:00am. The competition will be open to a select group of individual 42 engineering students who will participate in a 3-day hackathon in Zone 3 using Ruby.

name: Piscine Photoshop Day 00
desc: Cette première journée vous permettra de découvrir le logiciel Photoshop ainsi que quelques outils de base.

name: Piscine Photoshop Day 01
desc: Cette journée sera entièrement consacrée à la photographie et plus spécifiquement à la retouche photo.

name: Piscine Photoshop Day 02
desc: Cette journée va vous permettre d’aller encore un peu plus loin dans le domaine de la photo et d'aborder photomontage.

name: Piscine Photoshop Day 03
desc: Cette journée est placée sous le signe de la créativité à l'aide du photomontage, alors c’est vraiment l’occasion de vous amuser.

name: Piscine Photoshop Day 04
desc: Journée d'introduction au webdesign, et à l’UX-UI. Réflexion sur l’ergonomie et l’expérience utilisateur de votre interface.

name: Piscine Photoshop Rush 00
desc: Création d'un univers global, avec son identité, ses personnages, ses décors, son ambiance etc... autour de la thématique du jeu vidéo.

name: Python
desc: Want to learn Python, the all-purpose programming language? Take this branch to study the essentials of programming and build your own games and tools.

name: Atlantis - Chatterbot
desc: Create a Chat bot to facilitate repetitive interactions.

name: Multilayer Perceptron
desc: Sujet proposé par l'association 42AI.  Ce projet est une introduction aux réseaux de neurones artificiels grâce à l'implémentation d'un multilayer perceptron.

name: ft_sommelier
desc: This project is the gateway to the machine learning branch. It will also help you become a master sommelier.

name: NP1
desc: This project introduces some aspects of the Software-Defined Networking (SDN), DevOps. In the course of the work, you will have the opportunity to interact with the network equipment, try to configure it and collect data using the Southbound and Northbound APIs. You will be able to create your own product and find out, which indicators are important for service providers. The project has many opportunities to use your creativity and to write your own algorithms for calculating various indicators.

name: Javascript
desc: Want to study web development? Take this project to learn about HTML, CSS, and Javascript - and then create a personal website of your own!

name: Doom Nukem
desc: Passez à la vitesse supérieure ! Suite du Wolf3D, le Doom Nukem pousse beaucoup plus loin les possibilités du Raycasting tout en y apportant une dimension de Game design, vous allez donc devoir réaliser un vrai jeu et pour cela c’est un mélange de Doom et de Duke Nukem 3D qu’il vous faudra réaliser ! De nombreux éléments fonctionnels de base sont identiques. Ils n’ont cependant pas été implémentés de la même façon par les concepteurs des deux jeux. A vous de trouver celle qui vous conviendra et qui vous permettra d’ajouter les features demandées comme celles que vous souhaitez y voir.

name: Teen Idol
desc: Here is the project that for HackHighSchool mentors to feedback each other on leadership qualities. You should fill out the grading spreadsheet on everyone in your cohort, and complete two assigned corrections.

name: Yellow Brick Road
desc: Tweet tweet.

name: H2S Project Editor T1
desc: This project is meant to give 50-100 points depending on how extensively you improve the original project.

name: roger-skyline-1
desc: This subject follows Init where you have learned some of the basic commands and first reflexes in system and network administration. This one will be a concrete example on the use of those commands and will let you start your first own web server.

name: Data Mining
desc: This is the umbrella project for a set of four tutorials on data science tools. Knowledge of Python is recommended before you start, so start with that branch first if you don't have experience.

name: uf_bird
desc: This project is the introduction to the libGDX library and mobile game development for mobile devices.

name: Total-perspective-vortex
desc: Apprenez à utiliser les outils python pour traiter des données en grandes dimensions, et créez une interface homme machine grâce aux ondes cérébrales.

name: b_libft
desc: This first project as a student of 42 will make you consolidate your acquired pool. You will recode a number of standard C library functions, as well as other utility functions that you will reuse throughout your curriculum.

name: b_printf
desc: Are you tired of making your displays by alternating ft_putstr and ft_putnbr? You are not allowed to use printf? Recode yours! This will be an opportunity to discover a feature of the C - the variadic functions - and train you to fine management of display options. You will then have the right to use your printf in all your subsequent projects.

name: CS-Joy
desc: Project make familiar you with Encrypted Traffic Analytics. You will be able to work with data that needed to understanding network traffic through Intraflow data, such as SPLT (Sequence of Packet Lengths and Arrival Times), byte distribution,  relative frequency for each byte in a flow, byte entropy, an initial data packet. Also, you can use and develop open source project for Encrypted Traffic Analytics - Joy.

name: Java
desc: Take this branch if you want to study for a College Board test on Java programming, or are interested to learn Java in general.

name: Plagiart
desc: Tired of being surrounded by static artworks in a digital world? The PlagiArt project consists of animating the artworks of Art42.Despite the title, the goal is not simply to plagiarize, but to enrich the ideas of the artist and their intentions (do your research).Your final result can be added, if you wish, to an Augmented Reality application forArt42. Your animations will then be available to visitors (to upload your rendering, visit tv.42.fr with the tag #plagiArt). Go crazy and put in practice your skills acquired during your AfterEffects Piscine.

name: Wildcard
desc: This project is a gift to you: You should self-study a programming skill that is new to you, and use it to create a portfolio project which you can proudly display on your Github for the world to see. This will help prepare you for mentoring students during Hack High School. Challenge yourself and show some creativity! This project should take you approximately 50hrs (minimum), please use the TimeLog to track your time.

name: HackHighSchool Mentorship Program
desc: Mentoring for Hack High School. You will be graded by the H2S Admin.

name: Go Programming
desc:
Go is a compiled language with powerful packages from
standard library, garbage collector and concurrency. This project is just a stub that points to the free online textbook, "The Little Go Book".

name: Piscine Illustrator Day 00
desc: Cette première journée vous permettra de découvrir le logiciel Illustrator ainsi que quelques outils de base.

name: C Piscine Shell 00
desc: This is the first module of your C Piscine. You will learn how to navigate your environment and work with Bash.

name: C Piscine Shell 01
desc: This is the second module for your C Piscine. In this module, you will gain a deeper understanding of how to use your environment and work with Bash.

name: C Piscine C 00
desc: This module is an introduction to C programming. You will learn how the write function works, as well as how loops operate.

name: C Piscine C 01
desc: This module introduces C programming. You will enhance your skills in using loops more advancedly than in the previous module.

name: C Piscine C 02
desc: This module is an introduction to C programming. In this module, you will learn how to enhance your functions by implementing parameter validation and control mechanisms.

name: C Piscine C 03
desc: This module introduces C programming. You will learn how to manipulate strings in this module.

name: C Piscine C 04
desc: This module provides an introduction to C programming. In this module, you will continue working with strings and learn how to manipulate integers.

name: C Piscine C 05
desc: This module provides an introduction to C programming. You will be required to implement small algorithms using recursive programming.

name: C Piscine C 06
desc: This module is an introduction to C programming. You will learn how to use C arguments not only in your functions but also in your program as a whole.

name: C Piscine C 08
desc: This module is an introduction to C programming. In this module, you will learn how to manipulate libraries by creating custom libraries.

name: C Piscine C 09
desc: This module is an introduction to C programming. In this module, you will learn how to create your first Makefile. It is important to understand how these files work.

name: C Piscine C 10
desc: This module is an introduction to C programming. In this module, you will use all the skills you have learned before and create complete programs!

name: C Piscine C 11
desc: This module is an introduction to C programming. In this module, you will explore some advanced algorithms.

name: C Piscine C 12
desc: This module is an introduction to C programming. In this module, you will discover the famous linked list.

name: C Piscine C 07
desc: This module serves as an introduction to C programming. You will strengthen your skills by implementing various algorithms, allowing you to deepen your understanding and go further!

name: C Piscine C 13
desc: This module is an introduction to C programming. In this module, you will learn about binary trees.

name: Machine Learning
desc: An introduction course on Machine Learning using Python

name: H2S Project Editor T2
desc: For this project you complete a HackHighSchool project written by another cadet - and then, you make it better!

name: Pygame
desc: This should be fun! Build a game in Pygame - but you'll need learn a little bit of object oriented programming first.

name: Node.js
desc: A guided introduction to setting up Node and Express. You will create your own back-end API.

name: C Piscine Rush 00
desc: In this rush, you will be working in a group! This is a great opportunity to collaborate, communicate, and share your knowledge with your teammates

name: C Piscine Rush 02
desc: In this rush you will be confronted with having to work in a group! This is a good time to share your knowledge!

name: C Piscine Rush 01
desc: In this rush you will be confronted with having to work in a group! This is a good time to share your knowledge!

name: Libft
desc: This project is your very first project as a student at 42. You will need to recode a few functions from the C standard library, as well as some other utility functions that you will use throughout your whole curriculum.

name: miniRT
desc: This project is an introduction to the beautiful world of Raytracing.

name: ft_printf
desc: This project is pretty straightforward, you have to recode printf. You will learn what is and how to implement variadic functions. Once you validate it, you will reuse this function in your future projects.

name: Exam Rank 02
desc: This project will evaluate your abilities and knowledge about programming.

name: cub3d
desc: This project is inspired by the world-famous eponymous 90's game, which was the first FPS ever. It will enable you to explore ray-casting. Your goal will be to make a dynamic view inside a maze, in which you'll have to find your way.

name: get_next_line
desc: May it be a file, stdin, or even later a network connection, you will always need a way to read content line by line. It is time to start working on this function, which will be essential for your future projects.

name: ft_server
desc:
This project is intended to introduce you to the basics of system and network administration.
It will allow you to install a complete web server, using a deployment technology named Docker.

name: ft_services
desc:
This project consist to clusturing an docker-compose application and deploy 
it with Kubernetes.

name: libasm
desc: The aim of this project is to become familiar with assembly language.

name: minishell
desc: The objective of this project is for you to create a simple shell.

name: webserv
desc:
This project is here to help you write your own HTTP server.
You will be able to test it with a real browser.
HTTP is one of the most used protocols on the internet.
Knowing its intricacies will be useful, even if you won’t be working on a website.

name: Philosophers
desc: This project aims to teach concurrent programming, focusing on multithreading and multiprocessing.

name: ft_containers
desc: The multiple available containers in C++ all have a very different usage. To make sure you understand them all, let's re-implement them!

name: ft_irc
desc: Create your own IRC server in C++, fully compatible with an official client.

name: ft_transcendence
desc: This project is centered around the design, development, and organization of a full-stack web application.

name: D00 - HTML
desc: Premier plongeon dans la piscine. Découverte de HTML en bonne compagnie.

name: D01 - CSS
desc: Découverte de CSS3 avec les mimignons.

name: D03 - Javascript
desc: Dynamisez vos sites avec Javascript.

name: Data Structures
desc: Here is the content that used to be the 2nd half of the OOP branch, covering Linked Lists, Stacks and Queues. Ask your mentors to write projects for Hashtables and Trees too!

name: APCSP Prep
desc: Although we cannot provide you with a place to take any AP exams, we can help you study for the AP Computer Science Principles test if you are able to take the test at your own school. Join this project to study specific topics beyond "intro to programming" which will be on the test.

name: Python-101 D00
desc: Découverte des bases sémantiques et syntaxiques de Python.

name: Python-101 D01
desc: Aujourd'hui nous allons découvrir la lecture et l'écriture de fichiers, le format de données json, et comment manipuler tout ça avec Python.

name: Python-101 D02
desc: Et c'est le grand plongeon dans le monde merveilleux des APIs

name: ft_hangouts
desc: The goal of this project is to introduce you to mobile application development. You will build a contact management app for Android, allowing users to create, manage, and interact with their contacts. Throughout the project, you will learn how a mobile app works, how the Android system manages application lifecycles, and how to use the Android SDK effectively.

name: taskmaster
desc: This program is a job control task, in any language. The project is very close to the supervisor program on your computer

name: computorv1
desc: The goal of this project is to get acquainted with handling elementary math tools that may be helpful for other 42 projects. You will not “do math for doing math”, but to develop a progressive and relaxed approach to projects where these tools are needed. You can choose the language of your choice for this subject.

name: gomoku
desc: This project involves creating, in the language of your choice, a Gomoku game integrating an AI player capable of beating a human player the fastest way possible. To do this, you will implement a min-max algorithm but also do research, trial and error to find the most adapted heuristics. This will not be as easy as checkers.

name: expert-system
desc: This project involves creating, in the language of your choice, an expert system in proposal calculation. In other words, a program that can reason on a set of rules and initial facts to deduce other facts.

name: n-puzzle
desc: We are going to do, in any language, a program capable to solve n-puzzles of various sizes, as optimized as possible

name: nibbler
desc: This project in C++ will make you recode a Snake where you can switch the interface at run time

name: 42run
desc: Do you know the mobile game Temple Run? Time to settle and create it on your own! This OpenGL project aims to create a graphic game using the power of GPUs, manipulating 3D meshes, and implementing classical gameplay features.

name: strace
desc: First step in a serie of projects in C language leading to creation of a mini-GDB, this project will ask you to recode strace, a tool allowing you to list syscalls done by a running program

name: bomberman
desc: Bomberman is a classic video game: as simple in its gameplay as it is fun to play! You will leverage its simplicity here to undertake your first major professional-grade C++ project. Your goal is to recode a version of Bomberman in C++ and OpenGL, with the aim of creating the most polished game possible.

name: scop
desc: Your introduction to 3D rendering on the GPU using OpenGL, Vulkan, or Metal. Through this small graphical project, you'll explore the core concepts of modern 3D graphics.

name: ft_linear_regression
desc: This project will be your first steps into AI and Machine Learning. You're going to start with a simple, basic machine learning algorithm. You will have to create a program that predicts the price of a car by using a linear function train with a gradient descent algorithm.

name: krpsim
desc: This algorithm project consists of creating a program that will optimize rendering of a process graph, with some resource constraints. It’s up to you to explore the existing algorithms and choose, possibly create, what you seem most fit. For this project, you can choose the language you want

name: rubik
desc: Non-trivial algorithm project: create a Rubik’s cube solver. You can choose the language you want for this project.

name: humangl
desc: This intermediate OpenGL project is an introduction to hierarchical modeling. You will learn to use matrices in order to link various parts of a humanoid model, and animate them.

name: swifty-companion
desc: This project is an introduction to mobile programming. The goal is to create, an application which will allow you to get infos about 42students, using the API.

name: camagru
desc: This project is a warm-up for web development. You will need to create a small, Instagram-like website that allows users to create and share photomontages. From scratch, you will implement the basic functionalities commonly used by any website with a user base.

name: ft_ping
desc: Re-coding the ping command will allow you to become acquainted with raw IP communication between two machines on a network.

name: ft_traceroute
desc: Re-coding the traceroute command will be the opportunity to deepen your knowledge of TCP/IP networks by following the paths of an IP packet from one machine to another.

name: ft_nmap
desc: Re-coding the nmap command will be the opportunity to deepen your knowledge of TCP/IP networks and thus understand advanced use of threads in real life.

name: matcha
desc: This second project introduces a more advanced tool for building web applications: the micro-framework. You are invited to create a dating site in the programming language of your choice. User interaction is at the heart of this project!

name: hypertube
desc: Hypertube introduces you to a powerful category of tools: MVC frameworks. You will learn how to work with an MVC framework—using the programming language of your choice—to build a video streaming website with content downloaded via the BitTorrent protocol.

name: ft_turing
desc: ft_turing will help you discover the turing model using imperative programming through an implementation of this model with OCaml

name: snow-crash
desc: This project is an introduction to computer security. Snow Crash will help you discover security in various sub-domains, with a developer-oriented approach. You will become familiar with several languages (ASM, Perl, Php, etc.), develop a certain logic to understand unknown programs, and become aware of problems related to simple programming errors.

name: darkly
desc: Introductory project to computer security in the specific field of the web, this project will have you dissect a vulnerable website. In doing so, you will develop your own approach to thinking about security in a web application and become aware of issues related to simple development errors, both from a programming and a design perspective.

name: swifty-proteins
desc: This project will give you the opportunity to create 3D scenes. For the most part, you will make an application that models ligands in 3D. This will also help you to deepen your knowledge of a mobile framework.

name: ft_ality
desc: This project will get you acquainted with problems linked to automatic syntax analysis (“parsin”) by studying finite automation in a combat game.

name: xv
desc: This project was designed by the Daher company and has you develop a graphic interface under Unity for optimizing industrial processes.

name: in-the-shadows
desc: This project wants you to develop a complete game using a bit of algo and a lot of creativity.

name: particle-system
desc: This infographics project is an introduction to the fascinating world of GPU programming. You will design a particle system while meeting performance constraints, using GPU libraries such as OpenGL, OpenCL, Metal, CUDA, or Vulkan to parallelize computations.

name: gbmu
desc: This project involves coding normal and color gameboy emulator. You will become familiar with electronic documentation, better apprehend hardware emulation and understand the inner working of a gameboy as well as roms.

name: cloud-1
desc: This project is an introduction to cloud servers.

name: ft_linux
desc: The first project of the Kernel branch! This is a simple LFS so that you can build your own distribution which will be used in the next projects

name: little-penguin-1
desc: The start of a series of challenges inspired by Eudyptula. You will get acquainted with many points of Kernel development.

name: rainfall
desc: Rainfall is an iso challenge slightly more complex than Snow Crash. You will have to dive deep into reverse engineering, learn to reconstruct a code, and understand it to detect faults. Will you reach the last level?

name: dr-quine
desc: This small algo project will get you acquainted with auto-replication problems and confront the Kleene recursion theorem.

name: woody-woodpacker
desc: A logical follow-up project on nm/otools that is designed to modify the headers of a ELF64 file. The goal here is to add a chunk of code and hide a non-stripped part of a file.

name: matt-daemon
desc: A Unix project to create a server-type daemon. This server will listen on a given port and interpret a list of commands.

name: process-and-memory
desc: An introduction to syscalls and memory management within linux kernel

name: drivers-and-interrupts
desc: Learn how to connect a driver to your kernel. We will use a keyboard driver for this project.

name: filesystem
desc: Create your own filesystem, for your linux kernel.

name: kfs-2
desc: Discover the world of Kernel Programming and learn how to create your very own Kernel from scratch.

name: kfs-1
desc: Discover the world of "Kernel Programming" and learn how to create your very own Kernel from scratch.

name: kfs-3
desc: Third Kernel from Scratch project. Learn how to manage the memory in you kernel.

name: music-room
desc: In a group, create a complete mobile app for collaborative playlists using a relevant SDK and API. The tasks include mobile native development, back-end development, and the creation of a REST API.

name: red-tetris
desc: The objective of this project is to develop a networked multiplayer Tetris game using a software stack that is exclusively Full Stack JavaScript.

name: h42n42
desc: A project introducing the OCSIGEN framework, used to create rich applications in OCaml. The goal is to design a simulator of bugs escaping a dangerous virus.

name: famine
desc: Welcome to the wonderful world of viruses, trojans and other <Insert random antiVirus software>… Your goal here is to put your skills on handling binary files and make your first virus. WARNING: this project is solely for educational purposes!

name: kfs-4
desc: Project aimed at creating an Interrupt Description Table and handle interrupts within your Kernel

name: kfs-5
desc: You must now develop process managing in your Kernel, by implementing how to interpret the command :(){ :|:& }

name: computorv2
desc: Now that you have programmed your equation solver, it’s time to go further. Computor V2 let’s you create your own calculator in command line, which will integrate your computor V1 as well as functions for matrix calculus, function resolution, calculation with complex numbers, etc.

name: avaj-launcher
desc: First project of the Java projects arc. Implementation of a simple Java program according to a given class diagram written in UML.

name: swingy
desc: This is the second project from the Java world at 42. You will learn to develop GUI applications with the SWING framework, in order to create an RPG game.

name: fix-me
desc: Final project of the Java Programming arc. You will write a program that simulates stock exchanges and handles trading algorithms, including networking and socket implementations.

name: kfs-6
desc: Keep on developping your own kernel. This project will help you set up your own filesystem.

name: kfs-7
desc: This project will teach you how to build your own syscalls for your kernel, as well as user accounts, sockets, and a Unix-like hierarchy. Almost a full kernel here!

name: kfs-8
desc: Build a module interface for your kernel.

name: kfs-9
desc: Create an ELF parser and loader for your kernel.

name: kfs-x
desc: This is the final kernel project. It just requires you to create a complete linux environment. Maybe name your kernel aswell?

name: pestilence
desc: Second virus project. Reuse the Famine base to add a hiding method of your code.

name: war
desc: Third virus project. Reuse Pestilence, and manage to have your binary modify its signature on runtime.

name: death
desc: Last virus project. Create with your Famine, Pestilence and War a real metamorphic code.

name: boot2root
desc: Security Challenge.In a group, search for various means to pass root on the ISO given to you.

name: ft_shield
desc: Use your skills to create a daemon to create your first basic trojan.

name: override
desc: If you thought Rainfall was easy, here’s a more daunting challenge. Override is last ISO that will have you search for faults present in the protected binaries, and re-build these binaries depending on their behavior.

name: ft_vox
desc: ft_vox is a project to introduce the voxel engine, inspired by minecraft, in which you must create a randomly generated world.

name: ft_ssl_rsa
desc: You will code your own random prime number generator and use it to make private RSA keys.

name: ft_ssl_md5
desc: You will recode part of the OpenSSL program, specifically the MD5 Hashing Algorithm.

name: ft_ssl_des
desc: You will reimplement part of the OpenSSL program, specifically BASE64, DES-ECB, and DES-CBC.

name: dslr
desc: Discover Data Science through this project by recreating the Hogwarts Sorting Hat using logistic regression!

name: shaderpixel
desc: Now that you are familiar with 3D objects and basic rendering techniques, we can get serious now and really work in the space of the graphic card. It’s up to you to design and create the weirdest objects thanks to shaders programming.

name: guimp
desc: The goal of this project is to create a graphic interface library. You will have to prove it works correctly with a small 2D image software. This library must as complete and modular as possible, the goal being to re-use it in future projects, whether for projects in the graphic branch or other projects of you training.

name: userspace_digressions
desc: Make your own userspace init binary.

name: multilayer-perceptron
desc: This project is an introduction to artificial neural networks through the implementation of a multilayer perceptron.

name: doom-nukem
desc: Doom Nukem pushes the possibilities of Raycasting much further while bringing a dimension of Game design, so you are going to have to make a mix of Doom and Duke Nukem 3D.  It's up to you to find the one that suits you and that will allow you to add the requested features as well as those you want to see there.

name: total-perspective-vortex
desc: Learn to use python tools to process large dimension data, and create a man-machine interface thanks to brainwaves.

name: abstract-vm
desc: This project puts you back in the water after the C++ piscine, and involves the creation of a virtual machine capable of executing a code in basic pseudo-ASM. You will thus use a stack for basic arithmetic operations, such as the dc command.

name: mod1
desc: This simulation graphic project will have you represent a surface in 3D, on which water will flow. Empirical or scientific (with many equations), recreate a wave, a tsunami or maybe just rain on your surface.

name: zappy
desc: You will now create a multi-player game in a TCP/IP network. The game will consist of a server managing the game field, a graphic client which displays the state of the board, and IA clients that connect to the server to pilot a player on the filed. This is a real complete project that will let you express your creativity on top of your technical knowledge.

name: lem-ipc
desc: You have already seen communication between processes on a network via TCP/IP. You are now going to use other UNIX tools so that processes can communicate locally. You will discover these tools by creating a client of a classic boardgame.

name: ft_script
desc: By re-coding the script command you will have the opportunity to understand interactions between user input and tty, notably line discipline as well as pseudo-terminals. Once the project finished, you will know why a Ctrl-C in your shell interrupts the ongoing program!

name: nm
desc: This project will educate you on a deeper comprehension of how linux handle executables, by re-creating the command nm

name: malloc
desc: What’s the deal with malloc? You’ve been using it since the piscine C but it’s not a system call. Find out the workings behind optimum memory management and recode it, as well as free and realloc.

name: ft_select
desc: The goal of this project is to get you started on terminal manipulation with termcaps. Here you will learn how to create a user interface for a program launched on the terminal.

name: lem_in
desc: Your ant colony must move from on point to another. How do you do it in the shortest time possible? This project will get you acquainted with graph traversal algorithms: your program will have to intelligently select paths and precise movements used by the ants

name: push_swap
desc: This project involves sorting data on a stack, with a limited set of instructions, and using the smallest number of moves. To make this happen, you will have to manipulate various sorting algorithms and choose the most appropriate solution(s) for optimized data sorting.

name: corewar
desc: This project involves creating a virtual arena, and having simplistic-language programs fight each other. You will thus get acquainted with VM conception (with instructions it recognizes, registers, etc) and compilation problems of an assembly language in bytecode. In bonus, the pleasure to have your champions fight in the arena.

name: fract-ol
desc: Discover 2D programming and the psychedelic universe of fractals in this project, using minilibX.

name: ft_ls
desc: For knowing the filesystem inside out, and how files and directories are sorted, you will code by yourself one of the most used command: ls.

name: Eu aceito
desc: A 42 São Paulo funciona como uma comunidade voltado à aprendizagem de tecnologia, e para seu funcionamento é essencial que seus membros combinem as regras de convívio e utilização de nosso espaço. Para isso, sua primeira atividade é ler nossos 2 documentos presentes neste projeto: Regulamentos e compromissos dos candidatos. Se estiver de acordo, siga as instruções no documento deste projeto para descobrir como enviar sua aceitação das regras. Ah, de quebra, você irá aprender um pouco sobre Git e outras ferramentas que são valiosas para o início de sua jornada na Piscina!

name: [DEPRECATED] Piscine PHP Symfony
desc: Piscines are an important time in your cursus, during which you will have the occasion to learn a new language, or even a new paradigm!

name: Piscine Ruby on Rails
desc: Piscines are an important time in your cursus, during which you will have the occasion to learn a new language, or even a new paradigm!

name: [DEPRECATED] Piscine Python Django
desc: Piscines are an important time in your cursus, during which you will have the occasion to learn a new language, or even a new paradigm!

name: [DEPRECATED] Piscine OCaml
desc: Piscines are an important time in your cursus, during which you will have the occasion to learn a new language, or even a new paradigm!

name: [DEPRECATED] Piscine Unity
desc: Piscines are an important time in your cursus, during which you will have the occasion to learn a new language, or even a new paradigm!

name: [DEPRECATED] Piscine Swift iOS
desc: Piscines are an important time in your cursus, during which you will have the occasion to learn a new language, or even a new paradigm!

name: CPP Module 00
desc: This first module of C++ is designed to help you understand the specificities of the language when compared to C. Time to dive into Object-Oriented Programming!

name: CPP Module 01
desc: This module is designed to help you understand memory allocation, references, pointers to members, and the usage of the switch statement in C++.

name: CPP Module 02
desc: This module is designed to help you understand ad-hoc polymorphism, function overloading, and orthodox canonical classes in C++.

name: CPP Module 03
desc: This module is designed to help you understand inheritance in C++.

name: CPP Module 04
desc: This module is designed to help you understand subtype polymorphism, abstract classes, and interfaces in C++.

name: CPP Module 05
desc: This module is designed to help you understand try/catch and exceptions in C++.

name: CPP Module 06
desc: This module is designed to help you understand the different types of casting in C++.

name: CPP Module 07
desc: This module is designed to help you understand templates in C++.

name: CPP Module 08
desc: This module is designed to help you understand templated containers, iterators, and algorithms in C++.

name: LinkedIn Profile Task
desc: This project is designed to provide all students with the opportunity to have their LinkedIn Profile checked and evaluated in order to ensure that they deliver the best possible professional impression when the LinkedIn profiles are shared with potential employers.

name: Open Project
desc: This project offers the opportunity for long-term project management on a topic of your choice, including some computer science related elements. Collaborate with other 42 students and complete within 6 months.

name: Work Experience I
desc: Your first step in a company is an important milestone in your 42 training. This employment project is designed to help you discover the professional world and apply your work ethic and adaptability in a real-world context. It represents a first asset for your resume and offers an opportunity to identify your future field of interest.

name: Work Experience II
desc: Your course 42 can be continued with a second period of professional integration: the second internship. This internship is the accomplishment of your journey, and will have you demonstrate your expertise professionally in a company. This will be the springboard for your career.

name: Part_Time I
desc: Your first step in a company is an important milestone of your 42 training. This internship entails discovering the professional world and putting your work and adaptation skills at the service of the market. This is a first element for your resume and the opportunity to see emerge your future domain of interest.

name: Part_Time II
desc: Your first step in a company is an important milestone of your 42 training. This internship entails discovering the professional world and putting your work and adaptation skills at the service of the market. This is a first element for your resume and the opportunity to see emerge your future domain of interest.

name: Startup Experience
desc: A good professional integration remains one of the fundamental objectives of the school. This project offers you the possibility of founding a startup and work on it as a full-time job for the next months.

name: Day00 - HTML
desc: Premier plongeon dans la piscine. Découverte de HTML.

name: Day01 - CSS
desc: Un jour pour faire de vous de véritables CSS artists

name: Old-IRC
desc: Create your own IRC server in C++, fully compatible with an official client.

name: [DEPRECATED] Old-CPP Module 00
desc:
This first module of C++ is designed to help you understand the specifities of the language when compared to C.
Time to dive into Object Oriented Programming!

name: [DEPRECATED] Old-CPP Module 01
desc: This module is designed to help you understand the memory allocation, reference, pointers to members and the usage of the switch in CPP.

name: [DEPRECATED] Old-CPP Module 02
desc: This module is designed to help you understand Ad-hoc polymorphism, overloads and orthodox canonical classes in CPP.

name: [DEPRECATED] Old-CPP Module 03
desc: This module is designed to help you understand Inheritance in CPP.

name: [DEPRECATED] Old-CPP Module 04
desc: This module is designed to help you understand Subtype polymorphism, abstract classes and interfaces in CPP.

name: [DEPRECATED] Old-CPP Module 05
desc: This module is designed to help you understand Try/Catch and Exceptions in CPP.

name: [DEPRECATED] Old-CPP Module 06
desc: This module is designed to help you understand the different casts in CPP.

name: [DEPRECATED] Old-CPP Module 07
desc: This module is designed to help you understand Templates in CPP.

name: [DEPRECATED] Old-CPP Module 08
desc: This module is designed to help you understand templated containers, iterators and algorithms in CPP.

name: [Deprecated]APCSP_00
desc: Complete this python assignment

name: IoTApp
desc: Create an IoT application or program that can use data from real parking sensors. This project is the best way to know more about Smart City technologies, also it a good way to push up your skills in creating customer-oriented apps. You can compare different IoT technologies like Z-Wave, ZigBee, BLE, LoRaWAN, Weightless, NB-IoT, Wi-Fi 6. It can help with choosing the best one regarding your future IoT project requirements.

name: 42 seoul my little tv
desc: 42 seoul test2

name: 42 Squads
desc: Teamwork skills are essential to your success as a software engineer. Working well with clients, colleagues, managers and other people in your workplace can help you complete tasks efficiently while creating an enjoyable environment both for yourself and others. Now it's the time to learn how to do so !

name: Piscine Java
desc: The Java piscine is developed in order to overcome the barrier to entry to the professional field. All days of the piscine are focused on learning and understanding the Java infrastructure and basic technologies which are used in enterprise development. Acquired knowledge will help you to understand the main language mechanics and develop the software conforming to the generally accepted standards.

name: darkly - web
desc: Projet introductif à la sécurité en informatique dans le domaine spécifique du web, ce projet va vous faire disséquer un site web vulnérable. Ce faisant, vous allez développer votre propre façon de penser sécurité dans une application web et prendre conscience des problèmes liés à de simples erreurs de développement, autant d'un point de vue programmation que d'un point de vue conception.

name: Basecamp Eu Aceito
desc: Configure a sua chave SSH e acesse o nosso servidor no Discord

name: Basecamp C 00
desc: Day 00,  Cell 00. In this cell, you will have your first encounter with OSINT (Open Source Intelligence). The goal is simple: to find a social media account using the provided information.

name: Basecamp C 01
desc: Day 00,  Cell 01. Continuing with OSINT, you will now need to conduct further research on the profile to discover potential usernames associated with the same user.

name: Basecamp C 02
desc: Day 00,  Cell 02. Almost there, this cell becomes more intriguing. You will need to determine the location where a picture was taken, but first, you have to locate the picture. Twitter may not be the best social media platform for finding pictures.

name: Basecamp C 03
desc: Day 00,  Cell 03. Metaphysics explores what transcends physics, the Metaverse delves into realms beyond our universe, and metadata extends beyond mere data.

name: Basecamp C 04
desc: Day 01,  Cell 04. This cell will introduce you to website misconfigurations that can lead to file exposure.

name: Basecamp C 05
desc: Day 01,  Cell 05. This cell will introduce you to website misconfigurations that may result in data exposure.

name: Basecamp C 06
desc: Day 01,  Cell 06. This cell will introduce you to website misconfigurations that may result in data exposure.

name: Basecamp C 07
desc: Day 01,  Cell 07. This cell will introduce you to website misconfigurations that may result in data exposure.

name: Basecamp C 08
desc: Day 02,  Cell 08. In this cell, you will be introduced to one of the most commonly used encodings, along with techniques for hiding data.

name: Basecamp C 09
desc: Day 02,  Cell 09. In this cell, you will be introduced to one of the most commonly used encodings, along with techniques for hiding data.

name: Basecamp C 10
desc: Day 02,  Cell 10. In this cell, you will be introduced to one of the most commonly used encodings, along with techniques for hiding data.

name: Basecamp C 11
desc: Day 02,  Cell 11. In this cell, you will be introduced to one of the most commonly used encodings, along with techniques for hiding data.

name: Basecamp C 12
desc: Bonus00. Introductory project on the concept of OTP using the RFC HOTP.

name: Basecamp C 13
desc: Bonus 01. Introductory project on the concept of RSA.

name: Basecamp Exam 01
desc: Exame 01, com a toalha, os lanchinhos e foco total!

Last but not least, you will have to read and agree with our rules of participation. Follow the instructions in the PDF for this project to get started and submit your acceptance of the rules. desc: Now you will master the skills of creating microservice application and deploying them to the Cloud using Micronaut framework and various Oracle technologies

name: Cellule2-0-gecko
desc: This cell you will be introduced to one of the most used encodings used. You will have to identify it and decode the text

name: Cellule2-1-gecko
desc: Now that you know a bit more about decoding, you should know that encodings can be nested... On this cell you will learn that is not that a big deal :)

name: Cellule2-2-gecko
desc: Encodings can be reverted. This makes it not quite secure to send sensitive data, or even store it, and here is where hashes come to help. On this cell you will have to find why do they work and how to break them.

name: Cellule2-3-gecko
desc: You will see that not all passwords can be found that easy on a pre-build wordlist. On this cell you will learn how to create your own wordlists based on a base wordlist.

name: ft_lex
desc: A project about lexical analysis and finite automata. In this project you will implement a powerful regex engine

name: ft_yacc
desc: A project about syntactic analysis and stack automata

name: Cellule0-0-Tyto
desc: In this cell you will have your first contact with OSINT. The goal is simple, find a social media account with the information provided.

name: Cellule0-1-Tyto
desc: Continuing with OSINT, now you will have to research a bit on the profile to find possible usernames related to this same user.

name: Cellule0-2-Tyto
desc: Almost over, this cell gets a bit more interesting.. You will have to find where a picture was takent but first you will have to find the picture, maybe twitter is not the ideal social media for pictures..

name: Cellule0-3-Tyto
desc: Metaphisics is what goes beyond physics, Metaverse is what goes beyond our universe, and Metadata goes beyond data ;)

name: Cellule1-0-weasel
desc: This Cell will introduce you to website misconfigurations that can lead to file exposure.

name: Cellule1-1-weasel
desc: This time you will learn to use a really useful tool for website security testing and information gathering. Will you be able to find the hidden directory?

name: Cellule1-2-weasel
desc: Here we have another missconfiguration that can be exploited. You will have to exfiltrate some information...

name: Cellule1-3-weasel
desc: Almost everything has a database... On this project you will have to break one to bypass the authentication panel.

name: UnleashTheBox

name: ft_microservices
desc: Now you will master the skills of creating microservice applications using Spring framework

name: ActiveConnect
desc: In this project, you will create a web application that utilizes OpenID for user authentication and authorization
